snippet: Wolverine Worldwide, an apparel maker, and two private equity firms have agreed to acquire Collective Brands, the footwear company behind Keds and Payless ShoeSource, in a deal valued at $2 billion including debt.
abstract: Wolverine Worldwide, an apparel maker, and two private equity firms have agreed to acquire Collective Brands, the footwear company behind Keds and Payless ShoeSource, in a deal valued at $2 billion including debt.

headline.main: Investor Group Carves Up Collective Brands
